# Parallel Programming Docs

## Custom partitioners for PLINQ and TPL

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md): Learn more about: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL
- [Implement dynamic partitions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-dynamic-partitions.md): Learn more about: How to: Implement Dynamic Partitions
- [Implement a partitioner for static partitioning](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-a-partitioner-for-static-partitioning.md): Learn more about: How to: Implement a Partitioner for Static Partitioning

## Data parallelism

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/data-parallelism-task-parallel-library.md): Read how the Task Parallel Library (TPL) supports data parallelism to do the same operation concurrently on a source collection or array's elements in .NET.
- [Write a Parallel.For loop](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-simple-parallel-for-loop.md): Learn to write Parallel.For loops in .NET in which you don't need to cancel the loop, break out of loop iterations, or maintain any thread-local state.
- [Write a Parallel.ForEach loop](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-simple-parallel-foreach-loop.md): In this article, learn how to enable data parallelism in .NET. Write a Parallel.ForEach loop over any IEnumerable or IEnumerable<T> data source.
- [Write a Parallel.For loop with thread-local variables](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-parallel-for-loop-with-thread-local-variables.md): See an example of how to write a Parallel.For loop in .NET that uses thread-local variables, which store and retrieve state in each separate task in the loop.
- [Write a Parallel.ForEach loop with partition-local variables](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-parallel-foreach-loop-with-partition-local-variables.md): See an example of how to write a Parallel.ForEach loop that uses partition-local variables in .NET.
- [Cancel a parallel loop](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-cancel-a-parallel-for-or-foreach-loop.md): Cancel a Parallel.For or Parallel.ForEach loop in .NET by supplying a cancellation token object to the method in the ParallelOptions parameter.
- [Handle exceptions in parallel loops](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-handle-exceptions-in-parallel-loops.md): Learn how to handle exceptions in parallel loops in .NET. See an example of how to wrap all exceptions from the loop in a System.AggregateException.
- [Speed up small loop bodies](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-speed-up-small-loop-bodies.md): Learn more about: How to: Speed Up Small Loop Bodies
- [Iterate file directories with the Parallel class](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-iterate-file-directories-with-the-parallel-class.md): Learn more about: How to: Iterate File Directories with the Parallel Class

## Dataflow

- [Dataflow](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/dataflow-task-parallel-library.md): Learn how to use dataflow components in the Task Parallel Library (TPL) to improve the robustness of concurrency-enabled applications.
- [Write messages to and read messages from a dataflow block](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-messages-to-and-read-messages-from-a-dataflow-block.md): Learn more about: How to: Write and read messages from a Dataflow block
- [Implement a producer-consumer dataflow pattern](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-implement-a-producer-consumer-dataflow-pattern.md): Understand how to implement a producer-consumer dataflow pattern using the TPL Dataflow Library in .NET.
- [Perform an action when a dataflow block receives data](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-perform-action-when-a-dataflow-block-receives-data.md): Learn more about: How to: Perform Action When a Dataflow Block Receives Data
- [Create a dataflow pipeline](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/walkthrough-creating-a-dataflow-pipeline.md): Create a dataflow pipeline, which is a series of components, or dataflow blocks. A dataflow block does a certain task to contribute to a larger goal.
- [Unlink dataflow blocks](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-unlink-dataflow-blocks.md): Learn more about: How to: Unlink Dataflow Blocks
- [Use dataflow in a Windows Forms app](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/walkthrough-using-dataflow-in-a-windows-forms-application.md): Learn more about: Walkthrough: Using Dataflow in a Windows Forms Application
- [Cancel a dataflow block](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-cancel-a-dataflow-block.md): Learn more about: How to: Cancel a Dataflow Block
- [Create a custom dataflow block type](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/walkthrough-creating-a-custom-dataflow-block-type.md): Learn more about: Walkthrough: Creating a Custom Dataflow Block Type
- [Use JoinBlock to read data from multiple sources](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-use-joinblock-to-read-data-from-multiple-sources.md): Learn more about: How to: Use JoinBlock to Read Data From Multiple Sources
- [Specify the degree of parallelism in a dataflow block](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-specify-the-degree-of-parallelism-in-a-dataflow-block.md): Learn more about: How to: Specify the Degree of Parallelism in a Dataflow Block
- [Specify a task scheduler in a dataflow block](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-specify-a-task-scheduler-in-a-dataflow-block.md): Learn more about: How to: Specify a Task Scheduler in a Dataflow Block
- [Use BatchBlock and BatchedJoinBlock to improve efficiency](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/walkthrough-using-batchblock-and-batchedjoinblock-to-improve-efficiency.md): Learn more about: Walkthrough: Using BatchBlock and BatchedJoinBlock to Improve Efficiency

## Parallel LINQ (PLINQ)

- [Introduction](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/introduction-to-plinq.md): Learn how to make queries in parallel using PLINQ in .NET. PLINQ stands for parallel Language-Integrated Query (LINQ).
- [Optimize queries for speedup](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/understanding-speedup-in-plinq.md): Learn more about: Understanding Speedup in PLINQ
- [Order preservation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/order-preservation-in-plinq.md): Learn more about: Order Preservation in PLINQ
- [Merge options](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/merge-options-in-plinq.md): Learn more about: Merge Options in PLINQ
- [Potential pitfalls](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/potential-pitfalls-with-plinq.md): Learn more about: Potential pitfalls with PLINQ
- [Create and execute a query](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-create-and-execute-a-simple-plinq-query.md): Learn more about: How to: Create and Execute a Simple PLINQ Query
- [Control ordering in a query](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-control-ordering-in-a-plinq-query.md): Learn more about: How to: Control Ordering in a PLINQ Query
- [Combine parallel and sequential LINQ queries](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-combine-parallel-and-sequential-linq-queries.md): Learn more about: How to: Combine Parallel and Sequential LINQ Queries
- [Handle exceptions in a query](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-handle-exceptions-in-a-plinq-query.md): Learn more about: How to: Handle Exceptions in a PLINQ Query
- [Cancel a query](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-cancel-a-plinq-query.md): Learn more about: How to: Cancel a PLINQ Query
- [Write a custom aggregate function](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/standard/parallel-programming/how-to-write-a-custom-plinq-aggregate-function.md): Learn more about: How to: Write a Custom PLINQ Aggregate Function
